= Using pswrdgen with IronPython (IP)=

As of this writing, testing with Microsoft's IronPython has just begun.

= Using IronPython's Console with pswrdgen =
Here is an example on how to use pswrdgen with IP's command line interface:
{{{
IronPython console: IronPython 2.0A3 (2.0.10724.00) on .NET 2.0.50727.832
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
>>> import sys
>>> sys.path.append("C:\Python24\Lib")
>>> import os
>>> import pswrdgen
>>> i = pswrdgen.pswrdgen()
>>> i.do_setup()
>>> i.menu()
********************************************
*                 pswrdgen                 *
*                  0.1.1                   *
*  http://code.google.com/p/pswrdgen       *
* ---------------------------------------- *
*   Semantic Password generator that uses  *
*  WordNet 2.1, random capitalization, and *
*   character swapping. Needs WordNet 2.1  *
********************************************
******************************
* Choose one of the below:   *
* 1) Generate password(s)    *
* 2) Change generate count   *
* 3) Change password length  *
* 4) Change all defaults     *
* 5) Display defaults        *
* 6) Exit                    *
******************************
> 

}}}
